body_html:
I got the same std::runtime_error when importing first matplotlib and then pytorch. However, when first importing torch, this error is not catched and the imports work:

import torch  # works, if imported before matplotlib
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

I guess this supports, what @soumith wrote above:

I think QApplication is emitting a std::runtime_error, but no one is handling it. import torch is catching that error (as part of it's initialization logic).

So a quick fix might be to import torch first (@joxeankoret).
body_text:
I got the same std::runtime_error when importing first matplotlib and then pytorch. However, when first importing torch, this error is not catched and the imports work:
import torch  # works, if imported before matplotlib
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

I guess this supports, what @soumith wrote above:

I think QApplication is emitting a std::runtime_error, but no one is handling it. import torch is catching that error (as part of it's initialization logic).

So a quick fix might be to import torch first (@joxeankoret).
body:
I got the same `std::runtime_error` when importing first matplotlib and then pytorch. However, when first importing torch, this error is not catched and the imports work:
```
import torch  # works, if imported before matplotlib
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
```

I guess this supports, what @soumith wrote above:
> I think QApplication is emitting a `std::runtime_error`, but no one is handling it. `import torch` is catching that error (as part of it's initialization logic).

So a quick fix might be to import torch first (@joxeankoret).
